shoddy.gloss: made of inferior workmanship and materials

shopsoiled.gloss: worn or faded from being on display in a store

shopworn.gloss: worn or faded from being on display in a store

shoreward.gloss: (of winds) coming from the sea toward the land

shorn.gloss: having the hair or wool cut or clipped off as if with shears or clippers

short-handed.gloss: inadequate in number of workers or assistants etc.

short-run.gloss: relating to or extending over a limited period

short-staffed.gloss: inadequate in number of workers or assistants etc.

short-term.gloss: relating to or extending over a limited period

short-winged.gloss: (especially of certain insects) having very short or rudimentary wings

shortened.gloss: shortened by or as if by means of parts that slide one within another or are crushed one into another

shortsighted.gloss: unable to see distant objects clearly

showery.gloss: (of weather) wet by periods of rain

showy.gloss: marked by ostentation but often tasteless
(used especially of clothes) marked by conspicuous display

shrimpy.gloss: (used especially of persons) of inferior size

shriveled.gloss: (used especially of vegetation) having lost all moisture
lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness

shrivelled.gloss: (used especially of vegetation) having lost all moisture
lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness

shrubby.gloss: of or relating to or resembling a shrub

shrunken.gloss: lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness

shamefully.gloss: in a dishonorable manner or to a dishonorable degree

sharply.gloss: changing suddenly in direction and degree
very suddenly and to a great degree

shortly.gloss: in a curt, abrupt and discourteous manner

shyly.gloss: in a shy or timid or bashful manner
